bug.short_desc: SELinux is preventing docker from 'open' accesses on the file file.
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: systemctl start docker SELinux is preventing docker from 'open' accesses on the file file.
***** Plugin catchall (100. confidence) suggests **************************
If you believe that docker should be allowed open access on the file file by default. Then you should report this as a bug. You can generate a local policy module to allow this access. Do allow this access for now by executing: # ausearch -c 'docker' --raw | audit2allow -M my-docker # semodule -X 300 -i my-docker.pp
Additional Information: Source Context system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 Target Context system_u:object_r:nsfs_t:s0 Target Objects file [ file ] Source docker Source Path docker Port <Unknown> Host (removed) Source RPM Packages Target RPM Packages Policy RPM selinux-policy-3.13.1-202.fc25.noarch Selinux Enabled True Policy Type targeted Enforcing Mode Permissive Host Name (removed) Platform Linux (removed) 4.7.0-0.rc4.git1.1.fc25.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jun 21 15:11:37 UTC 2016 x86_64 x86_64 Alert Count 1 First Seen 2016-07-17 18:01:46 CEST Last Seen 2016-07-17 18:01:46 CEST Local ID 658f4818-d350-4106-b5ca-a7c1c0a70197
Raw Audit Messages type=AVC msg=audit(1468771306.604:6709): avc: denied { open } for pid=5692 comm="docker" path="net:[4026531969]" dev="nsfs" ino=4026531969 scontext=system_u:system_r:docker_t:s0 tcontext=system_u:object_r:nsfs_t:s0 tclass=file permissive=1
Hash: docker,docker_t,nsfs_t,file,open
Version-Release number of selected component: selinux-policy-3.13.1-202.fc25.noarch
Additional info: reporter: libreport-2.7.1 hashmarkername: setroubleshoot kernel: 4.7.0-0.rc4.git1.1.fc25.x86_64 reproducible: Not sure how to reproduce the problem type: libreport
Do you have unconfined module disabled?

I have updated docker-selinux policy to allow this access.
Lokesh could you update the docker-selinux/docker package in rawhide with the latest code from docker-selinux master branch.
0ebaaaca1d35b81e86c7e38692da1145d58bcf78

(In reply to Daniel Walsh from comment #2) > I have updated docker-selinux policy to allow this access. > > Lokesh could you update the docker-selinux/docker package in rawhide with > the latest code from docker-selinux master branch. > > 0ebaaaca1d35b81e86c7e38692da1145d58bcf78
I also have a lot of other AVCs after updating of docker recently: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1357278
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 25 development cycle. Changing version to '25'.
This should be fixed in the current docker.
